(*sigh* I really wish I'd posted yesterday... but just so everyone knows, 
there's a good chance I'm suffering from a mild concussion, literlly. So if 
this seems a little odd then it's because I still can't seem to think 
straight or concentrate on anything involving movement or bright lights 
[i.e. my comp] Reply to Ks: The shields are currently down, but I'm raising 
them in this post. Sorry this is so long, I'll try to keep it shorter next 
time.)

Hysteria/Tavatron

Hysteria:

Hysteria couldn't take much more of this. The ship was a mess! It would take 
them weeks to get all of this repaired! Hysteria had waited long enough. She 
entered the final code and prayed the ship wouldn't explode. Outside the CF 
the shields came to life. They were feeding directly off the power core this 
time. Before it had only been auxilery power, but even in this state they 
wouldn't last long. Once she severed the power feed or they were hit by too 
much weapon's fire then that would be it. No more shields, and barely enough 
power left to reverse the lockdown using the console. She'd probably end up 
having to manually undo most of it anyway.

The scanners registered the prisoners heading her way, accompanied by the 
two Alliance 'bots that had been trying to get into the bridge. Well, they 
wouldn't get in here either, she'd make sure of that. She powered up the 
smaller console next to her and entered in another lockdown code:

"Computer, voice authorization  'Hysteria, beta12'."

Thick steel doors slid down from the ceiling and covered the entrance to the 
engine room where the power core was located. That was it. There were no 
more lockdowns and no more real defenses to speak of. This was all she could 
do short of engaging the approaching 'bots.

*****

Tavatron:

She couldn't believe this. This was complete and total chaos. Angel Prime 
had openly insulted their commander. Iron Raptor may not not be a great 
warrior, but she was an intelligent leader. Her compassion made her strong 
in other ways though sometimes it could blind one to the bitter truth. 
Tavatron could understand how their commander wanted to save the life of a 
fellow Maximal, but sometimes it was best to cut your losses. She knew the 
Alliance had no intention of returning Chordate. They were devious, sneaky, 
and diabolical, much like the Predacons.

Tavatron walked closer to Iron Raptor. She could sense her commander's 
uncertainty. Uncertainty in battle was a death wish. She had learned that 
the hard way. Tavatron didn't know what to do. She wanted to obey her 
commander, but she didn't want to stand by while the few Maximals that 
continued to battle were slautered. Where was the honor in that? Angel Prime 
was foolish to think that by challenging FZ he could hope to gain popularity 
among the Maximals. Tavatron sidestepped around Iron Raptor and stood beside 
Dinobot. She was being pulled apart by too many conflicting emotions. On the 
one hand she wanted to draw the fluid of her enemies, on the other she knew 
there was no victory to be had. She turned to face Dinobot:

"This is a pointless bloodshed. There would be no honor in continuing this 
fight. It would only endanger the lives of the wounded and battered 'bots 
that still remain functioning. This must end."

WHile she was speaking her own wounds had begun to leak mech fluid. Though 
Tavatron showed no signs of pain, the extent of her injuries seemed to 
suggest otherwise. Her body was covered in a fair amount of dried mech fluid 
and dirt. She looked terrible.
